original_title: Sri Lanka bans import of several single-use plastic items
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has gazetted a ban on the importation of single-use items including drinking straws, stirrers, plates, cups and plastic garlands, among others.
According to the gazette issued Friday April 07, the importation of the following items will be banned effective June 01.
Single-use stirrers, single-use plates, single-use cups excluding yoghurt cups, single-use spoons, single-use forks, single-use knives and stringhopper trays

Any of the banned goods that arrive at any sea or Air ports of Sri Lanka on or after June 01 shall be re-exported to the exporting country within 30 days of the date of arrival of such goods, the gazette, signed by President Ranil Wickremesinghe in his capacity as Minister of Finance, said.
In February, Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers approved a proposal to ban seven single-use plastic items from June.
The decision was taken following recommendations from a committee appointed by the cabinet in August 2021. (Colombo/Apr07/2023)
